taj-mahal.name: Taj Mahal
taj-mahal.description: The Taj Mahal is an ivory-white marble mausoleum on the right bank of the river Yamuna in Agra, Uttar Pradesh, India. It was commissioned in 1632 by the Mughal emperor Shah Jahan to house the tomb of his favourite wife, Mumtaz Mahal.
taj-mahal.significance: Symbol of eternal love and one of the most recognizable structures in the world
taj-mahal.history: Built over 22 years by 20,000 artisans as a mausoleum for Mumtaz Mahal, who died during childbirth
taj-mahal.bestTimeToVisit: October to March, early morning or late afternoon for best lighting
taj-mahal.photography: Photography allowed in gardens, additional fee for main mausoleum

red-fort.name: Red Fort
red-fort.description: The Red Fort is a historical fort in the city of Delhi in India that served as the main residence of the Mughal emperors. Emperor Shah Jahan commissioned construction of the Red Fort on 12 May 1638, when he decided to shift his capital from Agra to Delhi.
red-fort.significance: Symbol of India's independence and Mughal power
red-fort.history: Built by Shah Jahan as his fortified palace when he moved the capital to Delhi
red-fort.bestTimeToVisit: October to March, avoid summer heat
red-fort.photography: Photography allowed, video camera charges extra

qutub-minar.name: Qutub Minar
qutub-minar.description: The Qutub Minar is a minaret and victory tower that forms part of the Qutb complex, a UNESCO World Heritage Site in the Mehrauli area of Delhi, India. It is a 73-metre tall tapering tower of five storeys, built in 1193 by Qutb-ud-din Aibak.
qutub-minar.significance: Tallest brick minaret in the world and symbol of Islamic conquest
qutub-minar.history: Started by Qutb-ud-din Aibak and completed by his successors
qutub-minar.bestTimeToVisit: October to March, early morning or evening

golden-temple.name: Golden Temple
golden-temple.description: The Golden Temple, also known as Harmandir Sahib, is a gurdwara located in the city of Amritsar, Punjab, India. It is the holiest gurdwara and the most important pilgrimage site of Sikhism.
golden-temple.significance: Holiest shrine of Sikhism and symbol of equality
golden-temple.history: Built by Guru Arjan Dev, the fifth Sikh Guru
golden-temple.bestTimeToVisit: October to March, visit during evening prayers
golden-temple.photography: Photography allowed, be respectful during prayers

mysore-palace.name: Mysore Palace
mysore-palace.description: The Mysore Palace is a historical palace and a royal residence at Mysore in the Indian State of Karnataka. It is the official residence of the Wadiyar dynasty and the seat of the Kingdom of Mysore.
mysore-palace.significance: One of the most visited monuments in India after the Taj Mahal
mysore-palace.history: Current structure built after the old palace was destroyed by fire
mysore-palace.bestTimeToVisit: October to February, visit during Dasara festival
mysore-palace.photography: Photography not allowed inside, exterior photography permitted

gateway-of-india.name: Gateway of India
gateway-of-india.description: The Gateway of India is an arch-monument built in the early twentieth century in the city of Mumbai, in the Indian state of Maharashtra. It was erected to commemorate the landing of King George V and Queen Mary at Apollo Bunder on their visit to India in 1911.
gateway-of-india.significance: Symbol of Mumbai and witness to British colonial history
gateway-of-india.history: Built to commemorate the visit of King George V and Queen Mary
gateway-of-india.bestTimeToVisit: November to February, evening time for sunset views

virupaksha-temple-hampi.name: Virupaksha Temple, Hampi
virupaksha-temple-hampi.description: The Virupaksha Temple is located in Hampi in the Ballari district of Karnataka, India. It is part of the Group of Monuments at Hampi, designated as a UNESCO World Heritage Site.
virupaksha-temple-hampi.significance: Oldest functioning temple in Hampi and center of pilgrimage
virupaksha-temple-hampi.history: Continuously worshipped since 7th century, expanded during Vijayanagara period
virupaksha-temple-hampi.bestTimeToVisit: October to February, early morning for prayers

stone-chariot-hampi.name: Stone Chariot, Hampi
stone-chariot-hampi.description: The Stone Chariot is an iconic structure located within the Vittala Temple complex in Hampi, Karnataka. It is one of the most photographed monuments in Hampi and represents the pinnacle of Vijayanagara architecture.
stone-chariot-hampi.significance: Symbol of Hampi and masterpiece of stone carving
stone-chariot-hampi.history: Built during the reign of Krishnadevaraya in the 16th century
stone-chariot-hampi.bestTimeToVisit: October to February, golden hour for photography
stone-chariot-hampi.photography: Photography allowed, very popular photo spot

aihole-temples.name: Aihole Temples
aihole-temples.description: Aihole is a historic site of ancient and medieval era Buddhist, Hindu and Jain monuments in Karnataka, India. It is known as the 'Cradle of Indian Architecture' with over 125 stone temples dating from 5th century CE.
aihole-temples.history: Capital of early Chalukyas, experimental ground for temple architecture
aihole-temples.bestTimeToVisit: October to March, early morning or late afternoon

belur-chennakeshava-temple.name: Belur Chennakeshava Temple
belur-chennakeshava-temple.description: The Chennakeshava Temple at Belur is a 12th-century Hindu temple in Hassan district of Karnataka state, India. It was commissioned by King Vishnuvardhana in 1117 CE, on the banks of the Yagachi River in Belur.
belur-chennakeshava-temple.significance: Masterpiece of Hoysala architecture and craftsmanship
belur-chennakeshava-temple.history: Built to commemorate Hoysala victory over the Cholas
belur-chennakeshava-temple.bestTimeToVisit: October to March, morning hours preferred
belur-chennakeshava-temple.photography: Photography allowed, flash not permitted inside

halebidu-hoysaleswara-temple.name: Halebidu Hoysaleswara Temple
halebidu-hoysaleswara-temple.description: The Hoysaleswara temple is a 12th-century Hindu temple dedicated to Shiva. It is the largest monument in Halebidu, a town in the state of Karnataka, India and the former capital of the Hoysala Empire.
halebidu-hoysaleswara-temple.significance: Finest example of Hoysala architecture with unparalleled sculptures
halebidu-hoysaleswara-temple.history: Built during the rule of King Vishnuvardhana and Narasimha I
halebidu-hoysaleswara-temple.bestTimeToVisit: October to March, early morning for detailed viewing
halebidu-hoysaleswara-temple.photography: Photography allowed, ideal for macro photography

badami-cave-temples.name: Badami Cave Temples
badami-cave-temples.description: The Badami cave temples are a complex of Hindu and Jain cave temples located in Badami, a town in the Bagalkot district in northern part of Karnataka, India. The caves are considered an example of Indian rock-cut architecture.
badami-cave-temples.significance: Earliest example of Chalukyan architecture and cave temple art
badami-cave-temples.history: Carved during the rule of Chalukya dynasty in 6th century
badami-cave-temples.bestTimeToVisit: October to March, morning hours to avoid heat
badami-cave-temples.photography: Photography allowed, tripod recommended for interiors

pattadakal-group-of-monuments.name: Pattadakal Group of Monuments
pattadakal-group-of-monuments.description: Pattadakal is a complex of 7th and 8th century CE Hindu and Jain temples in northern Karnataka, India. It was recognized as a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 1987 for its harmonious blend of architectural forms from northern and southern India.
pattadakal-group-of-monuments.significance: Harmonious blend of North and South Indian architectural styles
pattadakal-group-of-monuments.bestTimeToVisit: October to March, early morning preferred

bijapur-gol-gumbaz.name: Gol Gumbaz, Bijapur
bijapur-gol-gumbaz.description: Gol Gumbaz is the mausoleum of Mohammed Adil Shah, Sultan of Bijapur. The tomb, located in Bijapur, Karnataka, was completed in 1656. It is the second largest dome ever built, next only to St. Peter's Basilica in Rome.
bijapur-gol-gumbaz.significance: Second largest dome in the world and architectural marvel
bijapur-gol-gumbaz.history: Tomb of Mohammed Adil Shah, built during Adil Shahi dynasty
bijapur-gol-gumbaz.bestTimeToVisit: October to March, morning hours for echo experience
bijapur-gol-gumbaz.photography: Photography allowed, great for architectural shots

shravanabelagola.name: Shravanabelagola
shravanabelagola.description: Shravanabelagola is a town located near Channarayapatna of Hassan district in Karnataka, India. It is one of the most important Jain pilgrimage destinations in South India, famous for the 17.37-meter tall monolithic statue of Gommateshwara.
shravanabelagola.significance: One of the most important Jain pilgrimage sites in India
shravanabelagola.history: Statue carved during the reign of Western Ganga dynasty
shravanabelagola.bestTimeToVisit: October to February, early morning climb recommended
shravanabelagola.photography: Photography allowed, panoramic views from top

chitradurga-fort.name: Chitradurga Fort
chitradurga-fort.description: Chitradurga Fort is a fortification that straddles several hills and a peak overlooking the town of Chitradurga, in the Chitradurga district of Karnataka, India. The fort's name Chitrakaldurga, which means 'picturesque fort' in Kannada, is the namesake of the town.
chitradurga-fort.significance: Known as Kallina Kote (Stone Fortress) for its impregnable defenses
chitradurga-fort.history: Built by Nayakas of Keladi, later ruled by Hyder Ali and Tipu Sultan
chitradurga-fort.bestTimeToVisit: October to March, early morning for fort exploration
chitradurga-fort.photography: Photography allowed, great for landscape shots

bangalore-fort.name: Bangalore Fort
bangalore-fort.description: Bangalore Fort was a mud fort built by Kempe Gowda I in 1537. The present stone fort was built by Hyder Ali in 1761. It is located in the heart of Bangalore city, in the state of Karnataka, India.
bangalore-fort.significance: Important fort in Tipu Sultan's kingdom and Bangalore's history
bangalore-fort.history: Originally built by Kempe Gowda, rebuilt by Hyder Ali
bangalore-fort.bestTimeToVisit: October to March, morning hours preferred

tipu-sultan-summer-palace-bangalore.name: Tipu Sultan's Summer Palace
tipu-sultan-summer-palace-bangalore.description: Tipu Sultan's Summer Palace is located in Bangalore, Karnataka, India. It is an example of Indo-Islamic architecture and was the summer residence of the Mysorean ruler Tipu Sultan. The palace is made entirely of teak wood.
tipu-sultan-summer-palace-bangalore.history: Built by Tipu Sultan as his summer retreat
tipu-sultan-summer-palace-bangalore.bestTimeToVisit: October to March, morning hours for better lighting

melukote-cheluvanarayana-temple.name: Melukote Cheluvanarayana Temple
melukote-cheluvanarayana-temple.description: The Cheluvanarayana Swamy Temple is located at Melukote in the Mandya district of Karnataka, India. It is one of the important Vaishnavite pilgrimage centers in South India and is dedicated to Lord Vishnu.
melukote-cheluvanarayana-temple.significance: Important Vaishnavite pilgrimage center established by Ramanujacharya
melukote-cheluvanarayana-temple.history: Temple established by Sri Ramanujacharya in 12th century
melukote-cheluvanarayana-temple.bestTimeToVisit: October to March, festival times for special celebrations

murudeshwar-temple.name: Murudeshwar Temple
murudeshwar-temple.description: Murudeshwar is a town in the Bhatkal Taluk of Uttara Kannada district in Karnataka, India. The town is famous for the world's second tallest Shiva statue, the town lies on the coast of the Arabian Sea and is also famous for the Murudeshwar Temple.
murudeshwar-temple.significance: Home to world's second tallest Shiva statue
murudeshwar-temple.history: Ancient temple site with modern reconstruction and statue
murudeshwar-temple.bestTimeToVisit: October to March, sunset views are spectacular
murudeshwar-temple.photography: Photography allowed, great for coastal shots

hawa-mahal.name: Hawa Mahal
hawa-mahal.description: Hawa Mahal is a palace in Jaipur, India, approximately 300 kilometers from the national capital New Delhi. Built from red and pink sandstone, it is on the edge of the City Palace, Jaipur, and extends to the Zenana, or women's chambers.
hawa-mahal.significance: Iconic symbol of Jaipur and unique architectural marvel
hawa-mahal.history: Built by Maharaja Sawai Pratap Singh for royal women to observe street life
hawa-mahal.bestTimeToVisit: October to March, early morning for best lighting
hawa-mahal.photography: Photography allowed, best shots from opposite building

charminar.name: Charminar
charminar.description: The Charminar is a monument and mosque located in Hyderabad, Telangana, India. The landmark has become known globally as a symbol of Hyderabad and is listed among the most recognized structures in India.
charminar.significance: Symbol of Hyderabad and masterpiece of Qutb Shahi architecture
charminar.history: Built by Sultan Muhammad Quli Qutb Shah to commemorate the end of plague
charminar.bestTimeToVisit: October to March, evening time for illumination
charminar.photography: Photography allowed, great for night shots

victoria-memorial.name: Victoria Memorial
victoria-memorial.description: The Victoria Memorial is a large marble building in Kolkata, West Bengal, India, which was built between 1906 and 1921. It is dedicated to the memory of Queen Victoria and is now a museum and tourist destination under the auspices of the Ministry of Culture.
victoria-memorial.significance: Symbol of British colonial heritage and architectural grandeur
victoria-memorial.history: Built in memory of Queen Victoria, now serves as a museum
victoria-memorial.bestTimeToVisit: October to March, morning hours preferred
victoria-memorial.photography: Photography allowed in gardens, restrictions inside museum

india-gate.name: India Gate
india-gate.description: The India Gate is a war memorial located astride the Rajpath, on the eastern edge of the 'ceremonial axis' of New Delhi, India, formerly called Kingsway. It stands as a memorial to 70,000 soldiers of the British Indian Army who died in the period 1914–21 in the First World War.
india-gate.significance: National war memorial and symbol of sacrifice
india-gate.history: Built to commemorate soldiers who died in World War I and Afghan Wars
india-gate.bestTimeToVisit: October to March, evening time for illumination

meenakshi-temple.name: Meenakshi Amman Temple
meenakshi-temple.description: Meenakshi Temple is a historic Hindu temple located on the southern bank of the Vaigai River in the temple city of Madurai, Tamil Nadu, India. It is dedicated to Parvati, known as Meenakshi, and her consort, Shiva, here named Sundareswarar.
meenakshi-temple.significance: One of the most important temples in Tamil Nadu
meenakshi-temple.history: Ancient temple rebuilt in 17th century by Nayak rulers
meenakshi-temple.bestTimeToVisit: October to March, early morning or evening prayers
meenakshi-temple.photography: Photography allowed in outer areas, restrictions in inner sanctum

brihadeeswara-temple.name: Brihadeeswara Temple
brihadeeswara-temple.description: Brihadeeswara Temple, also called Rajarajeswaram or Peruvudaiyar Kovil, is a Hindu temple dedicated to Shiva located in South bank of Kaveri river in Thanjavur, Tamil Nadu, India. It is one of the largest South Indian temples and an exemplary example of a fully realized Dravidian architecture.
brihadeeswara-temple.significance: Masterpiece of Chola architecture and engineering
brihadeeswara-temple.history: Built by Raja Raja Chola I, represents the pinnacle of Chola art
brihadeeswara-temple.bestTimeToVisit: October to March, early morning for peaceful visit
brihadeeswara-temple.photography: Photography allowed, great for architectural details

lotus-temple.name: Lotus Temple
lotus-temple.description: The Lotus Temple, located in Delhi, India, is a Baháʼí House of Worship that was dedicated in December 1986. Notable for its flowerlike shape, it has become a prominent attraction in the city. Like all Baháʼí Houses of Worship, the Lotus Temple is open to all, regardless of religion or any other qualification.
lotus-temple.significance: Symbol of unity and modern architectural achievement
lotus-temple.history: Built as a Baháʼí House of Worship, designed by Fariborz Sahba
lotus-temple.bestTimeToVisit: October to March, evening time for peaceful meditation
lotus-temple.photography: Photography allowed in gardens, not inside the temple

akshardham-temple.name: Akshardham Temple
akshardham-temple.description: Swaminarayan Akshardham is a Hindu temple and spiritual-cultural campus in Delhi, India. The temple is close to the border with Noida. Also referred to as Akshardham Temple or Delhi Akshardham, the complex displays millennia of traditional and modern Hindu culture, spirituality, and architecture.
akshardham-temple.significance: Largest Hindu temple complex in the world
akshardham-temple.history: Built by BAPS Swaminarayan Sanstha, opened in 2005
akshardham-temple.bestTimeToVisit: October to March, full day visit recommended
akshardham-temple.photography: Photography not allowed inside, only in gardens

fatehpur-sikri.name: Fatehpur Sikri
fatehpur-sikri.description: Fatehpur Sikri is a town in the Agra District of Uttar Pradesh, India. The city itself was founded as the capital of Mughal Empire in 1571 by Emperor Akbar, serving this role from 1571 to 1585, when Akbar abandoned it due to a campaign in Punjab and was later completely abandoned in 1610.
fatehpur-sikri.significance: Perfectly preserved Mughal city and architectural marvel
fatehpur-sikri.history: Built by Akbar as his capital, abandoned due to water scarcity
fatehpur-sikri.bestTimeToVisit: October to March, early morning to avoid crowds
fatehpur-sikri.photography: Photography allowed, great for architectural photography

amber-fort.name: Amber Fort
amber-fort.description: Amer Fort or Amber Fort is a fort located in Amer, Rajasthan, India. Amer is a town with an area of 4 square kilometres located 11 kilometres from Jaipur, the capital of Rajasthan. Located high on a hill, it is the principal tourist attraction in Jaipur.
amber-fort.significance: Magnificent example of Rajput architecture and royal grandeur
amber-fort.history: Built by Raja Man Singh I, expanded by successive rulers
amber-fort.bestTimeToVisit: October to March, early morning or late afternoon
amber-fort.photography: Photography allowed, additional charges for special areas

humayuns-tomb.name: Humayun's Tomb
humayuns-tomb.description: Humayun's tomb is the tomb of the Mughal Emperor Humayun in Delhi, India. The tomb was commissioned by Humayun's first wife and chief consort, Empress Bega Begum, in 1558, and designed by Mirak Mirza Ghiyas and his son, Sayyid Muhammad, Persian architects chosen by her.
humayuns-tomb.significance: First garden tomb in Indian subcontinent and inspiration for Taj Mahal
humayuns-tomb.history: Built by Bega Begum for her husband Emperor Humayun
humayuns-tomb.bestTimeToVisit: October to March, morning or evening for best light

ajanta-caves.name: Ajanta Caves
ajanta-caves.description: The Ajanta Caves are approximately 30 rock-cut Buddhist cave monuments which date from the 2nd century BCE to about 480 CE in Aurangabad district of Maharashtra state of India. The caves include paintings and rock-cut sculptures described as among the finest surviving examples of ancient Indian art.
ajanta-caves.significance: Masterpiece of Buddhist religious art and ancient Indian painting
ajanta-caves.history: Carved by Buddhist monks over several centuries
ajanta-caves.bestTimeToVisit: October to March, early morning to avoid crowds
ajanta-caves.photography: Photography allowed with restrictions, no flash inside caves

ellora-caves.name: Ellora Caves
ellora-caves.description: Ellora is a UNESCO World Heritage Site located in the Aurangabad district of Maharashtra, India. It is one of the largest rock-cut monastery-temple cave complexes in the world, featuring Buddhist, Hindu and Jain monuments, and artwork, dating from the 600–1000 CE period.
ellora-caves.significance: Epitome of Indian rock-cut architecture and religious harmony
ellora-caves.history: Carved over 400 years representing three major religions
ellora-caves.bestTimeToVisit: October to March, full day visit recommended
ellora-caves.photography: Photography allowed, additional charges for video

khajuraho-temples.name: Khajuraho Group of Monuments
khajuraho-temples.description: The Khajuraho Group of Monuments is a group of Hindu and Jain temples in Chhatarpur district, Madhya Pradesh, India, about 175 kilometres southeast of Jhansi. They are a UNESCO World Heritage Site. The temples are famous for their nagara-style architectural symbolism and their erotic sculptures.
khajuraho-temples.significance: Masterpiece of medieval Indian architecture and sculpture
khajuraho-temples.history: Built by Chandela dynasty rulers between 950-1050 CE
khajuraho-temples.bestTimeToVisit: October to March, early morning or late afternoon
khajuraho-temples.photography: Photography allowed, great for architectural details

konark-sun-temple.name: Konark Sun Temple
konark-sun-temple.description: The Konark Sun Temple is a 13th-century CE Hindu Sun temple at Konark about 35 kilometres northeast of Puri on the coastline of Odisha, India. The temple is attributed to king Narasimhadeva I of the Eastern Ganga Dynasty about 1250 CE.
konark-sun-temple.significance: Architectural marvel representing the Sun God's chariot
konark-sun-temple.history: Built by King Narasimhadeva I of Eastern Ganga dynasty
konark-sun-temple.bestTimeToVisit: October to March, sunrise and sunset views are spectacular
konark-sun-temple.photography: Photography allowed, perfect for sunrise/sunset shots

sanchi-stupa.name: Sanchi Stupa
sanchi-stupa.description: Sanchi Stupa is a Buddhist complex, famous for its Great Stupa, on a hilltop at Sanchi Town in Raisen District of the state of Madhya Pradesh, India. It is located, about 46 kilometres northeast of Bhopal, and 10 kilometres from Besnagar and Vidisha in the central part of the state of Madhya Pradesh.
sanchi-stupa.significance: Oldest stone structure in India and Buddhist pilgrimage site
sanchi-stupa.history: Originally built by Emperor Ashoka in 3rd century BCE
sanchi-stupa.bestTimeToVisit: October to March, early morning for peaceful visit
